result.execSummary:
The defendant Alvin Hart was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Provide a DNA sample.

supervisions.notes:
*With 51 days credit leaving 40 days total in the HOC. Court orders Huber privileges for work, school, treatment and funeral leave from 04-20-2018 though 04-29-2018 from 8:00 a.m. to 7 p.m. Court does not object to electronic monitoring for funeral leave only.
*Court orders defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $90.00 due on today's date (04-20-2018) paid through the Clerk of Courts Office. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 
*Court waives all mandatory costs and fines due to defendant's income.
*Court orders costs, fees and assessments by 5/3/2016 or civil judgment.
Consecutive to: To any other sentence with credit for 19 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work only.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Alvin Hart

records.addlTxt: Restitution packet, Check issued May 16 2018.
Mailed notice to victim. DZ

Defendant Alvin Hart in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Samuel Tufford appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Sentencing hearing on revocation. 

As to COUNT 3 ONLY:

Court orders defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $90.00 due on today's date (04-20-2018) paid through the Clerk of Courts Office. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. 

Court waives all mandatory costs and fines due to defendant's income. 

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 91 days at the House of Correction with 51 days credit leaving 40 days total in the HOC. Court orders Huber privileges for work, school, treatment and funeral leave from 04-20-2018 though 04-29-2018 from 8:00 a.m. to 7 p.m. Court does not object to electronic monitoring for funeral leave only.

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Attorney Francisco Araiza in court, defendant Alvin Hart not in court, in custody.  Lucy Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for sentencing after revocation. Defendant was not produced for today's proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing after revocation in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing on revocation scheduled for April 20, 2018 at 08:30 am.

PURSUANT TO Felony Division Directive 04-03 dated December 15, 2004 -
Per succession calendar this case is assigned and forwarded to Br. 47, Judge Yang, for sentencing after revocation of probation.  Sentencing transcript requested from court reporter's office this date.  jm
Received from the Department of Corrections, Request for Sentencing After Revocation of Defendant's Probation.  jm

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Restitution refund check packet

Defendant Alvin Hart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Alvin Hart in custody.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Statements from State, defense and defendant.
As to Count 3:  Court withheld sentence and placed defendant on 2 years probation with the following conditions:
- pay restitution in the amount of $190.00 to Brandon M.
- provide a DNA sample
- no municipal violations for retail theft during the term of probation
Court orders costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid during the term of probation to convert to a civil judgment.
The sentence runs consecutive to Count 4.
As to Count 4:    The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 7 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 19 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis. Stats to apply for work only.  Court objects to electronic monitoring.
Court orders costs, fees and assessments by 5/3/2016 or civil judgment.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief, received and filed
Certification of transcript of proceedings of PLEA HEARING commencing 02/29/2016 received and filed. (16 Pages.)
MCPS Violation Report, Filed
Bail conditions remain as previously set.

Case is on tape recorder and by court reporter:  William Carpenter.
Defendant Alvin Hart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 3 & 4:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  As to Counts 1 & 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered counts dismissed and read in.  
Court hears statement of Brandon M.    Brandon M. request $190.00 in restitution.
Court REMANDS the defendant and increased the cash bail.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Defendant Alvin Hart in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Case called.  Parties request time.
